org.itemscript.core.mappings
Class Mapper

java.lang.Object
  org.itemscript.core.mappings.Mapper

public final class Mapper
extends java.lang.Object

A utility class that allows you to use a Mapping to turn lists into lists, lists into maps, and maps into maps.

Author:
Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

Method Detail

listToList

public static <FROM,TO> java.util.List<TO> listToList(java.util.List<FROM> source,
                                                      Mapping<FROM,TO> mapping)
Map a List of values to a new List.

Type Parameters:
FROM - The type of values in the original List.
TO - The type of values in the new List.
Parameters:
source - The source List to map from.
mapping - The mapping to use.
Returns:
A new List of type TO.

listToMap

public static <TO,KEY> java.util.Map<KEY,TO> listToMap(java.util.List<KEY> source,
                                                       Mapping<KEY,TO> mapping)
Map a List of values to a new Map in which the keys will be the original values from the List, and the values will be the result of mapping those values.

Type Parameters:
TO - The type of values in the new Map.
KEY - The type of values in the original List.
Parameters:
source - The source List to map from.
mapping - The mapping to use.
Returns:
A new Map with keys of type KEY and values of type TO.

mapToMap

public static <FROM,TO,KEY> java.util.Map<KEY,TO> mapToMap(java.util.Map<KEY,FROM> source,
                                                           Mapping<FROM,TO> mapping)
Map a Map of values to a new Map. Each value in the original Map will be mapped, and the result placed under the same key in the new Map.

Type Parameters:
FROM - The type of values in the original Map.
TO - The type of values in the new Map.
KEY - The type of keys in both Maps.
Parameters:
source - The source Map to map from.
mapping - The mapping to use.
Returns:
A new Map with keys of type KEY and values of type TO.
